meanings.definition: To give a yellowish or golden color to something.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys ochering her artwork to make it look bright and sunny.
meanings.sent2: The artist is ochering the walls of the gallery to create a warm atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The children had fun ochering their lemonade stand sign with glitter.
meanings.sent4: The setting sun was ochering the sky with hues of gold and orange.
meanings.sent5: Her laughter ochered the room with joy and happiness.

meanings.definition: The act of applying a yellowish or golden color to something.
meanings.sent1: The ochering of the house exterior made it stand out in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: She used ochering to add a touch of elegance to her painting.
meanings.sent3: The ochering of the cupcakes made them look like little drops of sunshine.
meanings.sent4: The ochering of the leaves in autumn painted the landscape in warm tones.
meanings.sent5: The ochering of the costume gave the character a regal appearance.
